intro: Antidesma leptobotryum, commonly known as the slender-fruited antidesma, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red upon ripening. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
